Stars produce elements through nuclear fusion. This process releases a tremendous amount of energy.

[[☃ image 1]]

**Which of the following best explains how the process of fusion works?**

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.caption: *The Pleiades cluster of stars*

choices.clue: In nuclear fusion, smaller nuclei are combined to make larger nuclei.
choices.content: Smaller nuclei such as hydrogen are combined into larger nuclei such as helium.

choices.clue: Dividing a large nucleus into smaller nuclei is the definition of nuclear *fission*, not nuclear fusion.
choices.content: Larger nuclei such as carbon are split into smaller nuclei such as helium.

choices.clue: This described a process called *recombination,* and is not an example of nuclear fusion.
choices.content: A proton captures a free electron and forms an atom of hydrogen.
